main event: A pilot reported seeing a large domed object with three smaller objects accompanying it, all spherical in shape, during a daylight sighting on January 19, 1956.
interesting points: The large object was a brilliant green in color with a lighter shade of green on the underside.
The three smaller objects were approximately one-third the size of the large object and circled it for 1 minute and 15 seconds.
The large object appeared fuzzy around the outside edge, comparable to a large green pyrotechnic flare.
The objects passed approximately 5 miles to the right of the observer's aircraft at a slightly lower altitude.
The pilot had over 2,300 hours of fighter pilot experience and had seen similar objects on previous occasions.
sighted object: One large domed object and three smaller spherical objects accompanying it
photographs: No photographs present in the report
